description: The CompTIA Server+ certification validates your ability as an IT professional to plan, secure and maintain a variety of server equipment. CompTIA Server+ is an industry-recognized, vender-neutral credential designed to meet today's and future IT needs. CompTIA Server+ addresses the changing server environment, dealing with the latest technologies and trends, including virtualization, data centers, software-defined networking and network attached storage.
descriptionMD: The CompTIA Server+ certification validates your ability as an IT professional to plan, secure and maintain a variety of server equipment. CompTIA Server+ is an industry-recognized, vender-neutral credential designed to meet today's and future IT needs. CompTIA Server+ addresses the changing server environment, dealing with the latest technologies and trends, including virtualization, data centers, software-defined networking and network attached storage.
name: CompTIA Server+
subtitle: Planning, Maintaining and Securing Server Equipment

episodes.description: The CompTIA Server+ certification validates your ability as an IT professional to plan, secure and maintain a variety of server equipment. CompTIA Server+ is an industry-recognized, vender-neutral credential designed to meet today's and future IT needs. CompTIA Server+ addresses the changing server environment, dealing with the latest technologies and trends, including virtualization, data centers, software-defined networking and network attached storage.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don take a look at the various shape, sizes and characteristic of server form factors. They will discuss topics such as rack mount, tower and blade servers as well as server racks, dimensions and enclosures.
episodes.title: Server Form Factors

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss the various components that make up server hardware. They will explain the characteristics of the central processing units (CPUs) like multicore vs. multiprocessor, socket types, cache, CPU stepping and architecture. They take a look inside the server chassis to give viewers a chance to see what is inside a common server.
episodes.title: Server Components

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their discussion on the various components that make up server hardware. They explain the characteristics of random access memory (RAM). They talk about error correcting code (ECC) vs non-ECC memory, RAM standards such as DDR2 and DDR3. They also mention other major components such as hard drives, BIOS/UEFI, firmware, RAID controllers, power supplies and network interface cards (NICs).
episodes.title: Server Components Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don look at the different concepts and standards when looking at power utilization within servers, computers and a datacenter. They talk about 120,V 240,V 208V and 440V circuits. They talk about basic calculations to ensure that we are providing the right power for the equipment that are in networks today.
episodes.title: Power and Cooling

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don look at the different concepts and standards when looking at power utilization within servers, computers and a datacenter. They discuss power consumption, redundancy, plug types, the NEMU standards, Edison plugs and cooling concepts.
episodes.title: Power and Cooling Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don examine preparing a server for operating system installation. They discuss determining server roles, firmware updates, BIOS/UEFI configuration and boot order with a demonstration in a BIOS configuration interface.
episodes.title: Installing a Server OS

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their examination in preparing a server for operating system installation. They focus on RAID controller configuration, RAID types, disk preparation and file systems such as NTFS, Ext2,3,4, FAT32, ZFS and more.
episodes.title: Installing a Server OS Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their examination in preparing a server for operating system installation. They demonstrate performing an OS installation on Linux. They talk about installation automation, zero-touch installations, lite-touch installations, PXE, TFTP and more.
episodes.title: Installing a Server OS Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their examination in preparing a server for operating system installation. They finish the Linux installation and discuss joining the server to a domain, network configuration, patching, OS hardening, enabling services and server optimization.
episodes.title: Installing a Server OS Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don talk about various roles that can be configured on today’s server as well as some of the requirements for these roles. They discuss web servers, application servers, directory servers DHCP servers, DNS servers, remote access servers and more.
episodes.title: Server Roles and Requirements

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore various technologies that are used to administer to a server. They talk about concepts like local hardware administration through KVMs,  serial console connections, as well as their limitations. They look at network-based hardware administration through components like KVM over IPs, ILOs and iDRACs with a demonstration of HPE ILOs. Finally, they will discuss network-based operating system administration through technologies like Microsoft Windows’s RDP, the widely popular SSH and VNC.
episodes.title: Administering a Server

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore the concepts and techniques used in server maintenance. They look at the components of change management and patch management.
episodes.title: Server Maintenance

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of the concepts and techniques used in server maintenance. They look at outages and service level agreements(SLAs). They talk about  scheduled downtime, impact analysis, mean-time-to-failure (MTTR). They look at performance monitoring of hardware like CPU, memory, network and disk utilization and process monitoring.
episodes.title: Server Maintenance Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of the concepts and techniques used in server maintenance. They talk about indicators that let the technician know that there is an issue with a server like LED and LCD messages as well as error and beep codes. They also explain the types of devices that can be replaced when they fail such as fans, hard drives, RAM and blackplanes.
episodes.title: Server Maintenance Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of the concepts and techniques used in server maintenance. They look at preventative maintenance techniques like clearing dust out with ESD prevention through a electronics vacuum and proper shutdown procedures. Finally, they will talk about fault tolerance high availability through clustering, round-robin and heartbeats.
episodes.title: Server Maintenance Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore the realm of asset management and documentation. They will dive into topics like licensing, labeling and warranties. They talk about life cycle management, procurement, usage, end-of-life, disposal and inventory.
episodes.title: Asset Management and Documentation

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration into the realm of asset management and documentation. They will dive into the documentation that is crucial for any company to implement and maintain such as service manuals, network, architecture and data flow diagrams as well as SLAs, recovery and baseline documentation.
episodes.title: Asset Management and Documentation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss concepts surrounding virtualization. They look at Type 1 and 2 hypervisors, host machines vs. guest machines, resource allocation, hardware compatibility as well as the management interface.
episodes.title: Virtualization

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore the most common storage technologies found within servers today and some retired technologies. They talk about concepts like SAS, SATA, SCSI and Fibre Channel. They will also look at the important characteristics and specifications of these disk technologies.
episodes.title: Primary Storage Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore redundant array of independent disk or RAID technologies and configurations. They talk about RAID 0, 1 and 5 as well as the considerations when using RAID configurations.
episodes.title: Configuring RAID

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration redundant array of independent disk or RAID technologies and configurations. They talk about RAID 10, 01 and 50. They will look at configuration considerations such as capacity, bus types and capacity, hot and cold spares, as well as the characteristics of array controllers like memory, battery-backed cache and duplexing.
episodes.title: Configuring RAID Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don examine various storage technologies that can be utilized in small, medium and enterprise-level networks. They look at such technologies like direct-attached storage, network-attached storage, iSCSI and Fibre Channel over Ethernet or FCoE. They also dive into Fibre Channel implementation that use switch fabric, FC switches, LUNs and LUN masking as well as JBOD, tape drives, USB and optical drives.
episodes.title: Storage Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explain the concepts around storage capacity. They talk about the different measurements between drive manufacturers such as gigabyte vs. gigibyte as well as disk quotas in Windows and Linux. They discuss compression and capacity planning considerations.
episodes.title: Storage Capacity

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don examine a very important security implementation called physical security. They will talk about multi factor authentication, mantraps, RFID chips, biometrics, keypads, security cameras and more.
episodes.title: Physical Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don talk about a server security technique called server hardening. They explain the common steps to hardened a system like system patched, disabling unneeded services, ports and default accounts and more. They explore vender specific hardening technologies from VMWare, Windows Server 2012, RedHat and the NSA. They will also look at application hardening and endpoint security.
episodes.title: Server Hardening

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore various technologies used in network security. They look at host-based ,network-based firewalls, port security 802.1x, network access control, ACLs, NIDS. They will also explain authentication protocols like LDAP, RADIUS, TACACS, TACACS+. Finally, they will examine the characteristics and components of public-key infrastructure or PKI.
episodes.title: Network Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of various technologies used in network security. They dive into VPN technologies an explain the security benefits of VPN. They also look at IPsec, VLANS and DMZs
episodes.title: Network Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss various aspects of proper and security disposal of storage devices. They talk about file-level, disk-level and tape encryption. They also examine soft wipe vs hard wipe formatting, physical destruction of the media as well as remote data wipes.
episodes.title: Secure Storage Disposal

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss security through logical access control. They look at permissions such as read, write and execute as well as permission inheritance. They also talk about management of permission through users and groups/
episodes.title: Logical Access Control

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their discussion on logical access control. They explain file permissions vs. share permissions and how these permission sets interact. They also look at network access control lists and distribution lists.
episodes.title: Logical Access Control Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore various power concepts related to environmental controls. They explain uninterruptible power supplies and the characteristics such as runtime vs. capacity, graceful shutdown automation, bypass procedures, maximum load and remote management.
episodes.title: Environmental Controls

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of various power concepts related to environmental controls. They explain power distribution units or PDUs and the characteristics associated with them such as PDU ratings, UPS ratings, total potential draw and redundancy considerations through multiple circuits.
episodes.title: Environmental Controls Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of various power concepts related to environmental controls. They explain common safety concerns such as ESD procedures, lifting techniques, rack stability, floor load limitations. Finally, they will discuss heating, ventilation and AC or HVAC systems, hot aisle and cold isle as well as controlling and monitoring temperature as well as humidity in server closets
episodes.title: Environmental Controls Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss the basics of IP addressing and common services used in TCP/IP. They talk about various topics such as IPv4, IPv6, static vs. dynamic IP address configurations, default gateways, classless inter domain routing, DNS and WINS.
episodes.title: IP Addressing and Services

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their discussion on the basics of IP addressing and common services used in TCP/IP. They talk about network address translation, port address translation, NIC teaming, speeds and duplex types.
episodes.title: IP Addressing and Services Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore TCP/IP ports and protocols. They explain the purpose of ports, port ranges, TCP vs. UDP as well as taking a look at some of the common protocols that are used within todays networks.
episodes.title: Ports and Protocols

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore  the concepts and components of cable management. They look at copper media and talk about the attributes of CAT 5, 5e, CAT 6 cabling as well as mentioning the different copper cable types such as crossover straight through, and rollover. They will also look at fiber optic cabling and discuss  LC, ST, SC and RJ-45 connectors.
episodes.title: Cable Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration on the concepts and components of cable management. They look at topics like cable placement and routing through vertical and horizontal management trays, bend radius protection and cable channels.
episodes.title: Cable Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explain disaster recovery principles. They discuss hot, cold and warm site types, replication methods like disk-to-disk, server-to-server and site-to-site. They will explore continuity of operations techniques through planning including disaster recovery plans (DRPs), business continuity plans and business impact analysis.
episodes.title: Disaster Recovery Principles

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don tackle the concepts of backup techniques. They look at common backup methodologies, backup medium, restoration and medium retention best practices and backup location considerations.
episodes.title: Backup Techniques

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss the concepts surrounding steps used in troubleshooting methodologies. They talk about identification of problems, determining the scope, establishing theories of probable cause. They will also explore testing theories, action plans, implementing the action plan, root cause analysis and documentation.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Methodologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explain the basics of troubleshooting hardware. They talk about common problems like POST failing, memory failures, CPU and hard drive failures. They look at some of the common causes, environmental issues as well as looking at some hardware tools.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Hardware

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don tackle the world of troubleshooting software. They talk about user log on problems, resource access issues and memory leaks. They will also address some of the common causes of these problems
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Software

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of the world of troubleshooting software. They talk about BSODs, kernel panics, boot failures, driver issues, runaway processes and drive mounting issues. They will also address some of the common causes of these problems
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Software Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration of the world of troubleshooting software. They talk about system log write errors, slow operating system performance, patch update failures, service failures, print issues and more. They will also address some of the common causes of these problems.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Software Part 3

episodes.description: In this, episode Wes and Don tackle troubleshooting networking issues that arise on modern networks. They talk about various topics such as Internet connection failures, resource unavailability, DHCP issues, DNS issues and more.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Networking

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes continue their exploration as they continue to tackle troubleshooting issues that arise on modern networks. They talk about various topics including routing issues, VLAN issues, port security, firewall issues and more.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Networking Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes continue their exploration as they continue to tackle troubleshooting issues that arise on modern networks. They talk about various topics including bad cables, bad operating system routes, host file configuration issues and more.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Networking Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don discuss various problems that arise when storage troubleshooting. They look at problems like slow file access, OS not found, error lights, data corruption and more.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Storage

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don explore troubleshooting security. They talk about common security problems like file integrity, privilege esculation and application whitelisting.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration on troubleshooting security. They talk about network file access issues, excessive access and permissions considerations.
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Security Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Don continue their exploration on troubleshooting security. They talk about excessive memory utilization, open ports, active and inactive services, firewall rules as well as discussing some of security tools used like port scanners, sniffers and anti-malware
episodes.title: Troubleshooting Security Part 3
